cards.front: What are Newton's laws of motion?
cards.back:
1. An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force. (Law 1: Inertia) 
2. The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass. (Law 2: F=ma) 
3. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. (Law 3: Action-Reaction Law)

questions.stem: Which of the following is NOT one of Newton's laws of motion?
options: The Second Law (F=ma) describes the relationship between force, mass and acceleration.
The First Law (an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same velocity unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.) is not a law of motion.

The Third Law (for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction) states that when one body exerts a force on a second body, the second body simultaneously exerts a force equal in magnitude and opposite in direction on the first body.
The Zero Law (the sum of all forces acting on an object is zero if and only if the acceleration of the object is also zero.) is not one of Newton's laws.
questions.rationale: The Zero Law is actually a restatement of Newton's Second Law for situations where the net force is zero.

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion - Key Insight
insights.takeaway: Fundamental principles governing the motion of objects, including the law of inertia (an object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion, unless acted upon by a net force), the second law (the acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the applied net force, and inversely proportional to its mass), and the third law (for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction).

questions.stem: Which of the following best describes the primary purpose of a machine learning algorithm?
options: To generate accurate predictions using training data
To manually program specific rules for decision-making
To create more efficient machine learning algorithms
questions.rationale: Machine learning algorithms learn from data and make predictions or decisions based on that learning.

insights.title: Machine Learning Basics Insight
insights.takeaway: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that focuses on the development of algorithms and statistical models to enable computers to learn from data, make decisions, and improve performance over time.
